text:
Has anyone got any great blog posts or articles on Unit Testing in Android that they’d recommend?

Also, I’d be curious to hear what people would recommend for Continuous Integration for Android Apps. Is Jenkins a possibility or is there something better?
<@U2YGFPQEL> here's a really good blog series on testing - <https://riggaroo.co.za/introduction-automated-android-testing/>

attachments.title: Introduction to Automated Android Testing - Part 1 - Riggaroo
attachments.text: In this blog post series, I am going to take a look at how to get started with Automated Android Testing. What it is, and how it can benefit your apps.
attachments.fallback: Riggaroo: Introduction to Automated Android Testing - Part 1 - Riggaroo

text: As far as unit testing goes, just read up on any Java Unit testing stuff. Ideally with unit tests you are only worried about Java code and not Android related logic.

attachments.fallback: [November 22nd, 2016 6:42 AM] michaelcarrano: <@U2YGFPQEL> here's a really good blog series on testing - <https://riggaroo.co.za/introduction-automated-android-testing/>
attachments.text: <@U2YGFPQEL> here's a really good blog series on testing - <https://riggaroo.co.za/introduction-automated-android-testing/>

text: <@U0XCFE6AH|niks> pinned a message to this channel.

Is it a good practice to use custom `IdlingResource` s for UI events, say custom animation? How do you guys usually register your `IdlingResource` s (before each test or inside of the tests before specific action)?
